result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Toddgrick James Shepherd

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Toddgrick James Shepherd not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Toddgrick James Shepherd.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests adjourned pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Toddgrick James Shepherd appeared by video.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Toddgrick James Shepherd.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests adjourned pretrial conference for possible global resolution.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Toddgrick James Shepherd not in court, in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel advises Court that defendant has a pending case and requests an additional pretrial date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Toddgrick James Shepherd in court, in custody.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Felicia S.C.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Toddgrick James Shepherd in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Toddgrick James Shepherd in custody.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Toddgrick James Shepherd appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
